channel.title: thtmnisamnstr
channel.description: Gavin Johnson's personal site. Resume, blog posts, tech product marketing stuff, maybe some tech-y stuff too.

item.title: YugabyteDB Open Source Community Spotlight – July 2021
item.description: We spotlight members of the community to recognize their contributions to making the Yugabyte community a great place. This month, we're honoring Radek Gruchalski, Managing Director and Software Engineer at Klarrio GmbH. Check out our post to learn more.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson

item.title: Distributed SQL Fundamentals: Horizontal Scaling
item.description: Scaling your SQL database can be difficult. Most traditional, legacy SQL databases are monolithic – they are constrained to a single server, VM, or container ...
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson

item.title: How reverse ETL can lighten your data load
item.description: Reverse ETL tools focus on customer data and are best used when combining data across websites, digital products, and cloud applications.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson

item.title: Yugabyte + Hasura Make it Easier to Build Complex, Global Applications
item.description: We partnered with Hasura to build an integration between Yugabyte Cloud and Hasura Cloud and to make building complex, global applications easier.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson

item.title: Why I Joined Yugabyte
item.description: This post is about about why I chose to work as a product marketer for Yugabyte over other companies.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson

item.title: How Data Engineers Use Automation to Give Your Business a Data-Backed Foundation
item.description: We cover the benefits for data engineers of automating tasks in six key areas, including data collection and Reverse-ETL.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson

item.title: The Future of Data Pipeline Tools Must Include Better Transformations Than ETL Ever Had
item.description: RudderStack Transformations New Feature Set Launch - RudderStack Transformations are easy to build, debug, and manage; and they run in real-time. They’re data transformations that work like you think they should.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson

item.title: New Feature Roundup: Transformations API, Warehouse Syncs, Audit Logs, and More
item.description: This blog summarizes the latest RudderStack features and bug fixes for March 2021 - including Transformations API, Warehouse Syncs, and Audit Logs.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson

item.title: RudderStack's video pitch as a finalist at SXSW Pitch 2021
item.description: RudderStack's video pitch as a finalist at SXSW Pitch 2021
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson

item.title: Introducing our new RudderStack Pro Self-Serve Plans
item.description: Announcing the launch of RudderStack's Pro self-serve plans.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson

item.title: Customer Data Pipelines Play a Key Role in Data Privacy
item.description: Customer data pipelines play a critical role in the privacy of your customer data. In this post, we’ll explain how your customer data pipeline can help improve your data privacy and how to ensure your data privacy with RudderStack.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson

item.title: RudderStack is a finalist at SXSW Pitch 2021!
item.description: SXSW Pitch is the marquee event of South by Southwest Online. Out of more than 500 companies that applied to present at SXSW Pitch 2021, RudderStack was selected as one of the 40 finalists.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson

item.title: RudderStack’s Licensing Explained
item.description: Software licensing can be a tricky subject, especially when you are a commercial company building an open-source product like RudderStack. From a customer’s viewpoint, we see how this could be confusing. In this post, we’ll explain how our software is licensed.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson

item.title: Warehouse-First, the More Secure, Flexible, and Cost-Effective Application Architecture
item.description: Know what the warehouse-first architecture is, how it works, and whether warehouse-first is the way to go for your data stack.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson

item.title: Introducing RudderStack Cloud Extract and Warehouse Actions
item.description: Announcing the launch of our new features, Cloud Extract and Warehouse Actions.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson

item.title: RudderStack Cloud Extract - Feature Overview Video
item.description: Feature overview video for RudderStack Cloud Extract.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson

item.title: Why You Don’t Want a Customer Data Platform
item.description: The warehouse-first approach eliminates the problems that CDP users frequently face. It solves the use cases associated with a CDP.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson, Kostas Pardalis

item.title: Redefine Customer Data Analytics Using an Open Source Stack
item.description: Why you should use open source software to build your analytics stack and the types of tools you need along with some popular open source examples of each.
item.dc:creator: Savia Lobo, Gavin Johnson

item.title: RudderStack + GitHub Sponsors: Making Open Source More Sustainable for Developers
item.description: Announcing our launch partnership with GitHub for GitHub Sponsors for companies.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson

item.title: Warehousing all of our orgs dev.to data in less than 25 lines of code
item.description: I want to report on our org's dev.to performance. This is the first step, collecting and storing data.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson

item.title: Devs Wanted: Get paid to contribute to RudderStack's open source software
item.description: RudderStack partnered with GitHub Sponsors to launch an enhancement bounty program.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson

item.title: How to start building a better CDP for free with RudderStack Cloud Fre
item.description: Today, we launched RudderStack Cloud Free, a no time limit, no credit card required, completely free tier of RudderStack Cloud. Here's how to sign-up and start using it.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson

item.title: Start Building a Better CDP for Free With RudderStack Cloud Free
item.description: Today, we launched RudderStack Cloud Free, a no time limit, no credit card required, completely free tier of RudderStack Cloud...
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson

item.title: Adapting Code and Culture: How New Relic Went Open Source
item.description: To become a community-friendly, open source partner, we needed to transform how we create our instrumentation. Here’s how we did it.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson

item.title: Getting Started with Kafka Connect for New Relic
item.description: Easily build real-time observability pipelines with the New Relic Kafka connector. Learn how to set up the connector for both events and metrics, and start sending data.
item.dc:creator: Rahul Bhattacharya, Gavin Johnson

item.title: 50 Bucks + Tux: Turning a cheap Atom 2-in-1 into a Linux laptop
item.description: I took a cheap Windows tablet with a keyboard case and turned it into a Linux laptop.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson

item.title: Building a Portfolio/Resume Site with Gatsby, Part 4 - Automating deploys to Firebase with GitHub Actions
item.description: This is after your site is good to go and already and you want to eliminate some toil. This shows how to create GitHub Actions to build and deploy your Gastby site.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson

item.title: Create Grafana Dashboards with Prometheus Data Stored in New Relic
item.description: Learn how to store Prometheus data in New Relic and send that data to Grafana without having to adjust your existing dashboards.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson

item.title: Building a Portfolio/Resume Site with Gatsby, Part 3 - Deploying to Firebase
item.description: This is about customizing your Gatsby site. Part 1 was entry-level. Part 2 was work. This is part 3, deploying. When all your work goes public.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson

item.title: How to sign up for New Relic's new perpetual free tier
item.description: New Relic has a new free tier. Here's how to sign up.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson

item.title: Building a Portfolio/Resume Site with Gatsby, Part 2 - Customizing your site and merging your changes
item.description: This is about customizing your Gatsby site. Part 1 was entry-level. This is Part 2 though. Part 2 is much more involved. Part 2 is where you make your site your own.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson

item.title: Building a Portfolio/Resume Site with Gatsby, Part 1 - Setting up your environment and creating a local, themed site
item.description: My personal website sucks. So I'm going to update it using Gatsby.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Johnson
